extendedIngredients.name: lime juice
extendedIngredients.original: 2 to 3 tablespoons fresh lime juice, divided

extendedIngredients.name: serrano chile
extendedIngredients.original: 1 to 2 teaspoons chopped fresh serrano chile, including seeds
extendedIngredients.originalName: chopped fresh serrano chile, including seeds

extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 1 pound peeled cooked shrimp, cut into 1/2-inch pieces
extendedIngredients.originalName: peeled cooked shrimp, cut into 1/2-inch pieces

title: Shrimp with Salsa, Avocado, and Chips
summary: The recipe Shrimp with Salsa, Avocado, and Chips is ready in approximately 35 minutes and is definitely a tremendous gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian option for lovers of Mexican food. One serving contains 487 calories, 29g of protein, and 24g of fat. For $3.56 per serving, this recipe covers 27% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 4. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. It works well as a pretty expensive main course. If you have firm-ripe avocados, cilantro, ketchup, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the lime juice you could follow this main course with the Lime Angel Food Cake with Lime Glaze and Pistachios as a dessert. With a spoonacular score of 62%, this dish is good. Similar recipes are Pomegranate-Avocado Salsa with Spiced Chips, Fetan Avocado Salsa & Pita Chips, and Chips With Smoked Salmon and Avocado Salsa.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio. It has 4.4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 17 dollars.

productMatches.title: Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Straw yellow hue, accompanied by a close-focused nose of pear, apricot and white flowers. The fruity palate, with top notes of stone fruit, shows ripeness and roundness well supported by an elegant acidity and savoriness, ensuring a long, lingering finish.

instructions: Preparation                                                        Stir together tomatoes, onion, cilantro, chile, ketchup, 1 tablespoon lime juice, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Stir in shrimp and season with salt and pepper.                                                                Mash avocados with remaining 1 to 2 tablespoons lime juice and 1/2 teaspoon salt.                                                                 Divide shrimp mixture among jars and layer avocado, cabbage, and crumbled chips on top.                                                 Cooks' note:            Assembled jars, without crumbled chips, can be chilled up to 6 hours. Add chips and serve at room temperature.

steps.step: Stir together tomatoes, onion, cilantro, chile, ketchup, 1 tablespoon lime juice, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Stir in shrimp and season with salt and pepper.
Mash avocados with remaining 1 to 2 tablespoons lime juice and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Divide shrimp mixture among jars and layer avocado, cabbage, and crumbled chips on top.
Assembled jars, without crumbled chips, can be chilled up to 6 hours.
Add chips and serve at room temperature.
